channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Meta's Ad Strength Gives Its AI Spending Some Cover
item.description: The Facebook parent is the latest to signal more capital spending ahead, but advertising is holding up.

item.title: Moderna’s stock slides 12% after it lowers full-year sales guidance
item.description: The second-quarter sales decline was mostly due to lower demand for the company’s COVID-19 vaccine.

item.title: Why the Fed Risks Falling Behind
item.description: Waiting until September to start cutting rates might have narrowed the Federal Reserve’s room for maneuver.

item.title: Eli Lilly’s tirzepatide showed positive results in late-stage trial as treatment for heart failure
item.description: Eli Lilly plans to submit the results to the FDA and other regulators later this year.

item.title: Umbrella Insurance Covers Worst-Case Scenarios. There Are Now More of Them.
item.description: While insurance premiums surged with inflation, coverage limits haven’t.

item.title: Big Tech’s AI bubble is alive and unwell
item.description: Stocks valued on potential profits from AI are trading on thin ice.

item.title: Stocks, Bonds Climb After Fed Meeting
item.description: The Nasdaq, S&P 500 and government bonds rallied on the final day of July, capping a topsy-turvy month for global markets.

item.title: Since 1995, value stocks have always outperformed when they’re this cheap — and by a big margin
item.description: Dodge & Cox’s David Hoeft says value stocks outperform over five years when they’re this cheap relative to growth stocks.

item.title: Bill Ackman Pulls Investment Fund IPO After Shrinking Its Size
item.description: The billionaire investor originally aimed to raise $25 billion in the offering before lowering the target to around $2 billion this week.

item.title: 16 stocks to exploit August’s explosive election-year gains
item.description: The stock market on average has performed well in August during presidential election years.
